summary: This document is an email chain from September 3, 2020, between a witness and members of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force. The emails discuss scheduling a virtual interview for the Epstein investigation, clarify that the witness does not need to appear in court as per the subpoena, and address the witness's question about legal representation.

persons.name: NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The sender of the emails, part of a joint task force, is coordinating a virtual interview with a witness in the Epstein investigation and clarifying subpoena procedures.

events.title: Proposed Virtual Interview
events.description: A virtual interview is proposed for 1 PM on Thursday, September 10, 2020, between the NYPD/FBI task force and a witness in the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

keyFacts: The NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force was actively investigating the Epstein case as of September 2020.
A witness was subpoenaed but agreed to a virtual interview instead of a court appearance.
The witness inquired about the necessity of having an attorney present for the interview, to which law enforcement stated the decision was up to the witness.
The email chain demonstrates standard procedure for witness interviews, including explaining rights as per the subpoena.
